IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO PROVIDE EDUCATION OF STUDENTS PRIMARILY IN GRADES 8 THROUGH 12.
IRS990.MissionDesc: OLDFIELDS SCHOOL IS COMMITTED TO THE INTELLECTUAL AND MORAL DEVELOPMENT OF YOUNG WOMEN. IN A CULTURE OF KINDNESS AND MUTUAL RESPECT, WE ENCOURAGE EACH STUDENT TO MAKE THE MOST OF HER ACADEMIC AND PERSONAL POTENTIAL. WE SEEK TO GUIDE EACH STUDENT TO GROW IN CHARACTER, CONFIDENCE, AND KNOWLEDGE BY ENCOURAGING HER TO EMBRACE THE VALUES OF PERSONAL HONESTY, INTELLECTUAL CURIOSITY, AND SOCIAL RESPONSIBILITY.
IRS990.Desc: FOUNDED IN 1867, OLDFIELDS SCHOOL COMBINES TRADITION AND INNOVATION WHILE REMAINING TRUE TO ITS FUNDAMENTAL MOTTO, "COURAGE, HUMILITY, AND LARGENESS OF HEART." APPROXIMATELY 180 BOARDING AND DAY GIRLS ARE ENROLLED, AND THE STUDENT BODY IS MADE UP OF A DIVERSE GROUP OF YOUNG WOMEN FROM ACROSS THE UNITED STATES AND AROUND THE GLOBE. APPROXIMATELY 89 COURSES, INCLUDING HONORS COURSES, ADVANCED PLACEMENT PREPARATION, SPECIAL SEMINARS, MAY PROGRAM, AND ART ELECTIVES ARE OFFERED. EACH GIRL'S EDUCATION IS TAILORED TO HER ABILITIES WITH AN AVERAGE CLASS SIZE OF 8 STUDENTS AND A 6:1 STUDENT TO FACULTY RATIO. OLDFIELDS FOCUSES ON ENSURING "EACH GIRL'S SUCCESS." OLDFIELDS SCHOOL IS LOCATED ON 140 RURAL ACRES NESTLED IN THE BUCOLIC HORSE COUNTRY OF NORTH BALTIMORE COUNTY, MARYLAND.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: CASH SURRENDER VALUE OF LIFE INSURANCE
INTEREST IN OIL AND GAS LEASE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN 2004, A FOREST STEWARDSHIP PLAN WAS PREPARED FOR MARYLAND GRID 907 X 628; TAX MAP 28 PARCEL 195 IN BALTIMORE COUNTY. THIS PLAN OUTLINES RECOMMENDATIONS BASED ON THE GOALS TO PRESERVE THE NATURAL HABITAT AND RESOURCES PRESENT. THE PLAN PROVIDES MANAGEMENT UNIT DESCRIPTIONS AND RECOMMENDED PRACTICES, GENERAL PROPERTY-WIDE RECOMMENDATIONS, COST-SHARE AND TAX ASSISTANCE PROGRAM ANALYSIS, AND A MANAGEMENT PRACTICE SCHEDULE.

THE EASEMENT IS MONITORED, INSPECTED, AND ENFORCED BY THE GROUNDS MAINTENANCE CONTRACTOR OF THE SCHOOL. THE COSTS OF PERFORMING THESE ACTIVITES ARE NOT SPEARATELY TRACKED, BUT RATHER, ARE INCLUDED IN THE GENERAL SERVICE CONTACT.

THE ORGANIZATION USES THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS AS SUPPORT FOR OPERATING EXPENSES THAT ARE NECESSARY TO FULFILL THE ORGANIZATION'S EXEMPT PURPOSE. THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE INVESTED UNDER THE SCHOOL'S INVESTMENT POLICIES TO COMPLY WITH THE STATE OF MARYLAND UNIFORM PRUDENT MANAGEMENT OF INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS ACT. THE BOARD APPROPRIATES THE EARNINGS OF THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS FOR EXPENDITURE TO SUPPORT DONOR STIPULATED PURPOSES.

ASC 740, INCOME TAXES (ASC 740), PRESCRIBES THE RECOGNITION AND MEASUREMENT OF A TAX POSITION TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN A TAX RETURN. IT ALSO PROVIDES GUIDANCE ON DE-RECOGNITION, CLASSIFICATION, INTEREST AND PENALTIES, ACCOUNTING IN INTERIM PERIODS, DISCLOSURE AND TRANSITION. FOR THOSE BENEFITS TO BE RECOGNIZED, A TAX POSITION MUST BE MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT TO BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES. THE AMOUNT RECOGNIZED IS MEASURED AS THE LARGEST AMOUNT OF BENEFIT THAT IS GREATER THAN FIFTY PERCENT LIKELY OF BEING REALIZED UPON ULTIMATE SETTLEMENT. THE SCHOOL RECOGNIZES INTEREST AND PENALTIES ACCRUED ON ANY UNRECOGNIZED TAX EXPOSURES AS A COMPONENT OF INCOME TAX EXPENSE. THE SCHOOL DOES NOT HAVE ANY AMOUNTS ACCRUED RELATING TO INTEREST AND PENALTIES AS OF JUNE 30, 2016 AND 2015.
COST OF GOODS SOLD NETTED WITH REVENUE 29,288.
FINANCIAL AID RECORDED AS A REDUCTION OF REVENUE 1,328,747.
COST OF GOODS SOLD NETTED WITH REVENUE 29,288.
FINANCIAL AID RECORDED AS A REDUCTION OF REVENUE 1,328,747.
THE SCHOOL'S POLICY IS PUBLISHED ANNUALLY IN THE BALTIMORE SUN. THE POLICY IS ALSO ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE AND IN THE STUDENT HANDBOOK.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: FINANCIAL AID IN THE FORM OF SCHOLARSHIPS AWARDED TO 52 STUDENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE STUDENT'S PARENT(S) APPLIES FOR THE FINANCIAL AID BY COMPLETING THE UNIFORM SSS FORM. MANAGEMENT REVIEWS THE SSS FORMS AND AWARDS FINANCIAL AID ON AN AS-NEEDED BASIS. THE AMOUNT OF EACH AWARD IS APPLIED TO THE RESPECTIVE STUDENT'S TUITION BILL.

AS A CONDITION OF EMPLOYMENT, PARNELL HAGERMAN AND DEROALD HOPKINS, ARE PROVIDED ON CAMPUS HOUSING FOR THE CONVENIENCE AND BENEFIT OF THE ORGANIZATION. THIS HOUSING IS NOT TAXABLE AND IS INCLUDED IN NONTAXABLE BENEFITS.
THE SCHOOL DOES NOT VALUE NONCASH CONTRIBUTIONS FOR PREVIOUSLY OWNED HORSES AND GOODS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT KEEP MINUTES FOR COMMITTEES WITH AUTHORITY TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BODY. MINUTES ARE ONLY DOCUMENTED FOR MEETINGS OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER AND THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL PERFORM THE INITIAL REVIEW. AFTER THEIR APPROVAL, THE FORM 990 IS THEN FORWARDED TO THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CHAIR OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR APPROVAL. THE FORM 990 IS ALSO MADE AVAILABLE IN THE BUSINESS MANAGER'S OFFICE FOR REVIEW BY THE FULL BOARD PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN ACCORDANCE WITH NAIS STANDARDS, ALL TRUSTEES AND KEY EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO SIGN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT ANNUALLY. THE ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT TO THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL SENDS ALL TRUSTEES A COPY OF THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST STATEMENT VIA EMAIL TO SIGN AT THE BEGINNING OF EACH FISCAL YEAR. THE STATEMENTS ARE FILED BY THE HEAD'S ADMINISTRATOR AND ARE KEPT ON FILE AND UP TO DATE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COMPENSATION FOR THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL IS DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE USES AIMS SUMMARY REPORTS OF COMPENSATION AS A GUIDELINE FOR SETTING COMPENSATION. COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS DETERMINED BY REVIEW OF COMPARABLE SALARIES AT PEER SCHOOLS AND MARKET REPORTS. THE HEAD OF SCHOOL REVIEWS AND APPROVES THESE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL MAKES AVAILABLE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS UPON REQUEST.
